abstract: Double bombing strikes Iranian Embassy compound in Beirut in deadliest assault on Iran's interests since it emerged as the most forceful backer of the Syrian government against an armed insurgency; frontal attack strikes a symbol of country's powerful influence in Lebanon and neighboring Syria; offshoot of Al Qaeda that operates in Lebanon claims responsibility.
lead_paragraph: The attack appeared to broaden the violent pattern of division across the Middle East linked to the civil war in Syria, where Iran has emerged as a powerful ally of the government side.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut, and Alan Cowell from London.

headline.main: Beirut Bombs Strike at Iran as Assad’s Ally
headline.print_headline: Beirut Bombs Strike at Iran As Assad’s Ally

snippet: The attack appeared to broaden the violent pattern of division across the Middle East linked to the civil war in Syria, where Iran has emerged as a powerful ally of the government side....
